head.supplied: 24 May 1891. ¶ To Professor J. L. A. de Quatrefages ¶ Member de l'Institute, Commander of the Legion of Honour, President of the Geographic Society of France, etc. ¶ Honored Sir. ¶ ¶ It is my pleasin...

div.p: To Armand de Quatrefages de Bréau
Royal Geographical Society of Australasia (Victorian Branch), box 52(d), Royal Historical Society of Victoria, Melbourne.
MS is a file copy bound with the minutes of the Council meeting of 5 November 1890. 24 May 1891.
To Professor J. L. A. de Quatrefages
Member de l'Institute, Commander of the Legion of Honour, President of the Geographic Society of France, etc.

It is my pleasing duty to inform you that the Victorian Council of the Royal Geographic Society of Australia has elected you an honorary member in recognition of distinguished services rendered by you through fully sixty years for the advancement of Science, these researches also have vastly extended the knowledge of geography in its application to anthropology and other sciences. In asking you to accept this mark of homage from young Society in antipodal distance, you will recognise the spirit of admiration in which we approach you, and by connecting your celebrated name with our geographic union here, you will elevate and encourage its efforts also in a distant land.

p.style: font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;
